messages.message:
*<!here>* Tomorrow, we will be migrating the Python CI pipeline to Python 3.9. This will be a two-step process where we first update the dependency snapshot, then merge in the pipeline/image update PR (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/69399).

This should be a relatively seamless transition, but it’s possible that a test which passes in Python 3.7 fails in Python 3.9. If so, please tag the appropriate test owners to fix their tests.

If you need to add a package to the dependency list, please add it to `third-party/bazel/py/requirements_py39_linux.in` and regenerate `third-party/bazel/py/requirements_py39_linux.txt`.

*Rollback plan:* In the event that it must be rolled back, can simply revert the pipeline PR and switch back to the old site-packages snapshot.

If you want to test this change ahead of time, please try stacking a PR against the update PR (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/69399)

Special thanks to @Anil for helping debug flow server tests, and @Cody Boggs for helping with Jenkins .
Do you already have a list of tests that fail in 3.9? If so, can you share that list?

So far, the only tests that we've seen fail in python 3.9 is

• TestDocSplitter (which we've marked (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/69399/commits/a03fcd8417380c7d6331ee1d442242b537b34156) as skip with a TODO
• `test_maintain_exif` which we've unblocked (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/69399/commits/737e3aa039bac3d5055ea5e2899b0fff0d270810) with a TODO. 
My test PR (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/69383/checks?check_run_id=40214191530) updates the python stubs, so it should in theory hit all python modules, but I put that warning in just in case.
ok great! i've created a ticket for our team to follow up on `TestDocSplitter` - cc @ayesha.ali
